review.reviewText: This is a boutique hotel with plenty of old world charm.  The rooms facing the malecon can be a bit noisy, but the garden rooms are just as nicely appointed and quieter.  Great location that is just off the malecon and only 2 or 3 blocks from the plaza, close to restaurants, markets and just about anything else.  I would go back.

managementResponses.response: Thanks so much, we expect to see you very soon,

review.title: Excellent Hotel Experience!!
review.reviewText: The staff was wonderful!  It was cozy and in an excellent location.  Walking distance from all restaurants and bars.  Across the street from Chapala Lake with a great board walk.  I would definitely stay there again!

managementResponses.response: Thanks so much, we expect to see you again very soon

review.title: Lovely Boutique style hotel
review.reviewText: Located right across from the Malecon and the lake it was a lovely spot.  The bed was very comfortable and the room well decorated. The continental breakfast was very nice. I definitely enjoyed my stay there

managementResponses.response: We are very plasent to hear you love you stay, thank so much

review.title: Lovely hotel located on the malecon of Chapala
review.reviewText: This well kept hotel is located steps from the malecon of Chapala. The malecon is wonderful for long strolls along the sometimes busy waterfront of Lake Chapala where you can watch the local fishermen and get within a few feet of the beautiful Snowy Egrets on the pier. The breakfast on the veranda at the front of the hotel surrounded by the lush garden is delightful. The comfortable rooms all have a unique musical theme to the decor.
review.locationRemarks: Walking on the malecon. Boat trips to an island on Lake Chapala are available (unless you are a drunked person - check the sign). Good restaurants.

managementResponses.response: Thanks so much for you coments, we are taking care about that situation.

review.title: Great location for Chapala Feria
review.reviewText:
Charming place, though some of decor a little dated. Knowledgable, helpful staff, one of best showers ever in mexico, luxurious linens. Had private front balcony (Hollywood), general rear balcony. Nice covered front porch and lovely rear garden,
Internet not great. Worked most of time in lobby, not always, and not in room
Good value for the money

review.title: tranquil
review.reviewText: The hotel is across from the lake, around the corner fro the main street in town and the garden was so tranquil with the music from the Hotel that I sat in the chair in the shade and fell a sleep.
review.negativeRemarks: don't fix what is not broken
review.locationRemarks: Its the perfect location due to the lake the church, main street in town, market place and the buses and taxis. let us not forget the restaurants

managementResponses.response: Thanks, we are try to work more with expedia to solve that situation

review.title: Very Nice Hotel, Nice Staff
review.reviewText:
We had room BB, which does not get much cross breeze.  This would be my only complaint about the stay, there are some other rooms with better ventilation but we did not get one of these.
NOTE - IF you reserve with Expedia, check your reservation directly with the hotel.  The hotel did not have our reservation, but honored the printout from Expedia.  This could have been bad on this holiday weekend!!
review.positiveRemarks: Authentic old Mexico flavor.  The place is clean and the staff is friendly. The rooms are smaller but well appointed, bathroom very well laid out.
review.negativeRemarks: Lake Chapala area cools down nicely at night, but there is no way to draw that air in and maintain privacy on the ground floor.
review.locationRemarks: We were exploring the Lake Chapala area looking for retirement options.

review.title: Close to the malecon
review.reviewText: Very close to everything in Chapla. Rooms are imacculate and staff is very good

review.title: Nice hotel
review.reviewText: Great comfortable beds and clean rooms. Great location in the heart of Chapala . Staff nice and accommodating. Downfall is that there is no A/C so windows stay open day and night which makes it difficult to stay asleep if you are a light sleeper. Church bells and roosters heard throught night.  School children on playground early in am.

review.title: shower
review.reviewText: the shower head had low pressure and it took a long time to get hot water.

review.title: Nice but costly...
review.reviewText: Hotel is located near everything you want to see in Chapala, but the hotel is not worth the price. The free breakfast was not more that a table with fruit and cereal and bed was not as comfortable. I would definitely stay there again if they would drop the price by 30-40%.

review.title: Beautiful venue near the lake
review.reviewText:
Do your research before you go to make sure there are no parades, celebrations slotted during your stay.  We were forced to move out due to the noise from the parade and carnival (prelude to Ash Wednesday) that went on until 3am every night we were there.  It was happening a few blocks away, but because of the amplification it sounded as though it was right next door.  

That said, the hotel is just simply amazing and the two-story suite right on the garden is glorious.  Also, the front desk folks were immensely helpful recommending places to eat and helping us arrange a backup hotel to stay at in Guadalajara when we decided we just could not put up with the noise any longer.
review.positiveRemarks: The rooms and the front desk staff.
review.negativeRemarks: Completely sound proof all the rooms.
review.locationRemarks: It is right across the street from Lake Chapala and is walking distance to many restaurants.

review.title: Central Chapala Location
review.reviewText:
A wonderful property with great staff.
The location is right on main street.  This has its pro's and con's.  If you are a light sleeper then the noise from church bells MAY bother you a little.  Unknowingly we came at Carnival time and so the night time music and crowd noise was loud up to a point...but that could be expected.
A slight miscommunication from the room (Hollywood) we were emailed as to be the room we were to be in for quoted rate to the room (Jazz) we were assigned at check in.  Smaller room but nice, more close to lobby and noise of lobby, but staff went out of their way and made payment adjustment to make it right.
Having a driver service at a very fair price to pick us up at Guadalajara airport, as well as take us back and a day trip for shopping was perfect.
review.positiveRemarks: Location, staff and price that included continental breakfast with add-on options for breakfast.

review.title: Good small hotel located on the malecon
review.reviewText: We enjoyed our stay at this small hotel which has direct access to the lovely malecon walkway of Chapala. The staff were very friendly and responded immediately to a minor concern with a dripping tap in our room. We enjoyed the modest morning breakfast that included juice, cereal, lots of fruit and muffins with the coffee. Other food is available for a modest price. The only thing we missed was an in-room safe and an English language news channel on the TV service. Chapala is a charming small city with a broad main street and the marvelous broad malecon walkway along the shore of the lake of the same name. The hotel has a quite garden area at the back that we enjoyed from the patio of our room.
review.negativeRemarks: Rooms could include an in-room safe and an English language news channel on the TV service.
review.locationRemarks: Walks on the malecon are easy from this hotel and Chapala always seems to have some sort of festival going on especially on the weekends.

review.title: Would go back again
review.reviewText: Great location across street from lake,easy walk to restaurants,very busy with locals,lots of noise but quite by 830.breakfast was good and other guests were happy with their rooms,parking was available at no charge but you need staff to open gate.
review.positiveRemarks: Location plus small dog was allowed.desk staff spoke good English and happy to assist

review.title: Interesting villa with a musical theme
review.reviewText: Was pleasantly surprised to find a unique villa transformed into a fascinating hotel with each rooms decor based on a musical theme. Beautiful original Mexican paintings graced the walls. Location was excellent and within easy walking  distance of cafes and restaurants and the lake. Beds very comfortable and duvet was appreciated as no heating in rooms. Breakfast was simple but quality, muesli, yoghurt, excellent fruit salad and freshly baked muffins. Menu was optional. Personable , friendly staff. A very memorable stay..
review.positiveRemarks: The tasteful decor and furnishings, comfortable beds, our little outdoor patio, excellent amenities.
review.negativeRemarks: Rooms were cold so a heater would have been appreciated
review.locationRemarks: Excellent location for walking to cafes, restaurants ,lake, handcraft vendors.

review.title: Nice Hotel, friendly staff, very clean, best local
review.reviewText:
We arrived late, were shown our room and directed to a nearby open restaurant.  Clean, friendly
staff, great location in Chapala near malecon.  Will return and stay again.  Allso nice breakfast
on porch.

review.title: Nice hotel close to everything.
review.reviewText: Cozy little hotel right in the heart of Lake Chapala town. I was surprised of the location rigth at front of the El Malec√≥n where all the fun and restaurants start.

review.title: Charming hotel!!!
review.reviewText: Very charming hotel with a courteous and helpful staff.  I would recommend this hotel, close to the lake, market and many wonderful restaurants!
review.positiveRemarks: Step back into a more peaceful time, but still had wifi access for when we "needed" to check in. Very quiet atmosphere with a lovely courtyard.

review.title: Nice hotel in Chapala central
review.reviewText: Excellent staff at this hotel.  Rooms were a bit small but very nice.  I would certainly return to this hotel.
review.negativeRemarks: Centralized AC.  Room was nice but got a little warm - only way to cool it was by opening windows/door.  Town has a nearly perfect climate
review.locationRemarks: Lake levels were down significantly from photos - different feel than expected due to this.  Malecon was 200 yards away from lake.
